syllabus:
**NTNU General English 3:  Literature & Culture** – **Autumn semester, 20****18**

**Instructor****:**  thomas (tom) nicoletti  倪通                  **Email:**  [tenicoletti@gmail.com](mailto:tenicoletti@gmail.com)

**Class meeting time****:**  Monday, 10:20 – 12:10     

**Objectives****:**

1)  to appreciate the content and reflect on the meaning of _Four Perfect Pebbles: A True Story of the Holocaust_;

2) to become more knowledgeable about the Holocaust and its significance;

3)  to build our vocabulary and become more fluent readers of English;

4)  to benefit from interacting with and sharing ideas with fellow classmates.

5)  to become more comfortable with and proficient at expressing ourselves orally;

**Course description****:**  In this course, we will read _Four Perfect Pebbles: A True Story of the Holocaust_, by Lila Perl and Marion Blumenthal Lazan.  This is the story of the Blumenthal family, a Jewish family in Germany that became trapped in the Nazi regime’s roundup and persecution of Jews prior to and during World War II.   It is also the story of strength, perseverance, and hope in the face of inhuman brutality.  This book has value not only as a chronicle of the Holocaust but also as a frame of reference for more recent “ethnic cleansing” atrocities and the plight of refugees around the world.    We will engage in group and whole-class discussions about the book.  Thus, it is expected that students will not be shy about using English to express their thoughts.  Another of our objectives is to build our English vocabulary, therefore, we will have two tests to help with that learning.  There will also be a written assignment and a speaking assignment.

**(IMPORTANT NOTE:  In the Thursday class, we will read a different book:  Mitch Albom’s bestselling book, _Tuesdays with Morrie_.  Albom describes a series of very touching and meaningful talks that he had with his former professor, Morrie Schwartz, who was dying of the disease ALS.)**

**Please note****:**  This course will be taught in English by a native English speaker.  Also, _Four Perfect Pebbles_ was written for a native English-speaking audience.  **Therefore, this course will require at least a high-intermediate level of English.**

**Grading guidelines****:**

*   Class participation             33%
*   Tests                                   40%
*   Individual written report   17%
*   Speaking assignment          10%

**General guidelines****:**

1.  Students will be expected to prepare the homework before coming to class.  This will enable us to have meaningful discussions and other activities.

1.  Please bear in mind that General English 3 is a required course.  Therefore, please come to class on time.  Being frequently late to class will affect your grade.  Also, and very importantly, more than three unexcused absences will put your grade in danger.  So please come to class.  We will try to make the course meaningful and enjoyable.  **In order to get an excused absence, use NTNU’s computer system to apply for a** **請假單** **.**

**Text****:**  _Four Perfect Pebbles: A True Story of the Holocaust_, by Lila Perl and Marion Blumenthal Lazan.  This will be delivered and available to buy in class in Week 4, so students don’t need to go out to a bookstore to buy it.
